trans-unit.source: Using the SFTP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the SFTP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the SFTP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the SFTP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the SFTP Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the SFTP Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Use the SFTP Connector to move data to and from an SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Use the SFTP Connector to move data to and from an SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: You can download files from or upload files or list files to and from an SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: You can download files from or upload files or list files to and from an SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the SFTP Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the SFTP Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Creating an SFTP connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Creating an SFTP connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “SFTP Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “SFTP Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Configure the SFTP connector as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the SFTP connector as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: **Web hosting plan** - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: **Web hosting plan** - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: **Name** - give a name for your SFTP Connector
trans-unit.target: **Name** - give a name for your SFTP Connector

trans-unit.source: Package settings
trans-unit.target: Package settings

trans-unit.source: **Server Address** - Specify the SFTP Server name or IP address
trans-unit.target: **Server Address** - Specify the SFTP Server name or IP address

trans-unit.source: **Accept Any SSH Server HostKey** - Determines if any SSH public host key fingerprint from the Server should be accepted.
trans-unit.target: **Accept Any SSH Server HostKey** - Determines if any SSH public host key fingerprint from the Server should be accepted.

trans-unit.source: If set to false, the host key will be matched against the key specified in the “SSH Server Host Key Finger Print” property
trans-unit.target: If set to false, the host key will be matched against the key specified in the “SSH Server Host Key Finger Print” property

trans-unit.source: **SSH Server HostKey** - Specify the fingerprint of the public host key for the SSH server - *optional*.
trans-unit.target: **SSH Server HostKey** - Specify the fingerprint of the public host key for the SSH server - *optional*.

trans-unit.source: **Root Folder** - Specify a root folder path.
trans-unit.target: **Root Folder** - Specify a root folder path.

trans-unit.source: If blank will default to root.
trans-unit.target: If blank will default to root.

trans-unit.source: **Encrypt Cipher** - Specify the encryption cipher - *optional*.
trans-unit.target: **Encrypt Cipher** - Specify the encryption cipher - *optional*.

trans-unit.source: **Server Port** - Specify the SFTP Server port number
trans-unit.target: **Server Port** - Specify the SFTP Server port number

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new SFTP Connector is created.
trans-unit.target: A new SFTP Connector is created.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the just created API App via Browse -> API Apps ->
trans-unit.target: Browse to the just created API App via Browse -> API Apps ->

trans-unit.source: and you can see that the "Security" component is not configured:
trans-unit.target: and you can see that the "Security" component is not configured:

trans-unit.source: Click on "Security" component to configure Security (User Name, Password, Private Key, PPK File password) for SFTP connector.
trans-unit.target: Click on "Security" component to configure Security (User Name, Password, Private Key, PPK File password) for SFTP connector.

trans-unit.source: Select "Password" or "Privatekey" or "MutliFactor" authorization tab under Security and provide the required properties:
trans-unit.target: Select "Password" or "Privatekey" or "MutliFactor" authorization tab under Security and provide the required properties:

trans-unit.source: Once the security configuration is saved, you can create a logic App in the same resource group to use the SFTP connector.
trans-unit.target: Once the security configuration is saved, you can create a logic App in the same resource group to use the SFTP connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the SFTP Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the SFTP Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the SFTP connector as a trigger/action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the SFTP connector as a trigger/action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the SFTP connector:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App and choose the same resource group which has the SFTP connector:

trans-unit.source: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:
trans-unit.target: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:

trans-unit.source: The SFTP connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side:
trans-unit.target: The SFTP connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side:

trans-unit.source: You can drop the SFTP Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “SFTP Connector”.
trans-unit.target: You can drop the SFTP Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “SFTP Connector”.

trans-unit.source: You can now use SFTP connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use SFTP connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can use the File retrieved from the SFTP trigger ("TriggerOnFileAvailable") in other actions in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can use the File retrieved from the SFTP trigger ("TriggerOnFileAvailable") in other actions in the flow.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The SFTP trigger "TriggerOnFileAvailable" deletes the retrieved file after processing the file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The SFTP trigger "TriggerOnFileAvailable" deletes the retrieved file after processing the file.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for SFTP trigger as Follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for SFTP trigger as Follows:

trans-unit.source: **Folder Path** - Specify the path of the Folder from which Files needs to be retieved.
trans-unit.target: **Folder Path** - Specify the path of the Folder from which Files needs to be retieved.

trans-unit.source: **The type of the file: text or binary** - Select the type of the file.
trans-unit.target: **The type of the file: text or binary** - Select the type of the file.

trans-unit.source: **File Mask** - Specify the file mask to be applied for retrieving files.
trans-unit.target: **File Mask** - Specify the file mask to be applied for retrieving files.

trans-unit.source: '*' retrieves all the files in the specified folder.
trans-unit.target: '*' retrieves all the files in the specified folder.

trans-unit.source: **Exclude File Mask** - Specify the file mask to be applied for excluding files.
trans-unit.target: **Exclude File Mask** - Specify the file mask to be applied for excluding files.

trans-unit.source: If the "File Mask" property is also set, the Exclude File Mask will be applied first.
trans-unit.target: If the "File Mask" property is also set, the Exclude File Mask will be applied first.

trans-unit.source: In the similar way you can use the SFTP actions in the flow.
trans-unit.target: In the similar way you can use the SFTP actions in the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can use the "upload File" action to upload a file to SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: You can use the "upload File" action to upload a file to SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Upload File" action as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Upload File" action as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Content** - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: **Content** - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: **Content Transfer Encoding** - Specify none or base64
trans-unit.target: **Content Transfer Encoding** - Specify none or base64

trans-unit.source: **File Path** - Specify the file path of the file to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: **File Path** - Specify the file path of the file to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: **Overwrite** - Specify "true" to overwrite the file if it already exists
trans-unit.target: **Overwrite** - Specify "true" to overwrite the file if it already exists

trans-unit.source: **Append If Exists **- Specify "true" or "false".
trans-unit.target: **Append If Exists **- Specify "true" or "false".

trans-unit.source: When set to "true", the data is appended to the file if it exists.
trans-unit.target: When set to "true", the data is appended to the file if it exists.

trans-unit.source: When set to "false", the file is overwritten if it exists
trans-unit.target: When set to "false", the file is overwritten if it exists

trans-unit.source: **Temporary Folder** - If provided, the adapter will upload the file to the 'Temporary Folder Path' and once the upload is done the file will be moved to 'Folder Path'.
trans-unit.target: **Temporary Folder** - If provided, the adapter will upload the file to the 'Temporary Folder Path' and once the upload is done the file will be moved to 'Folder Path'.

trans-unit.source: The 'Temporary Folder Path' should be on the same physical disk as the 'Folder Path' to make sure that the move operation is atomic.
trans-unit.target: The 'Temporary Folder Path' should be on the same physical disk as the 'Folder Path' to make sure that the move operation is atomic.

trans-unit.source: Temporary folder can be used only when 'Append If Exist' property is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Temporary folder can be used only when 'Append If Exist' property is disabled.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
